main event: On July 10, 1959, two individuals observed a streak of brilliant light in the sky over Potsdam, New York.
interesting points: The light was described as being about three feet long and one inch thick,There were two streaks of light moving rapidly with a one-foot space between them,One of the lights appeared to be brighter,The sighting lasted for about 2 minutes before the lights faded from view,The report suggests the object possessed characteristics of an aircraft rather than a meteor.
witness description: two individuals driving in a car
